Posted By: James_Kernaghan (4/24/2013 2:21:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I for one can't wait to see the Wizards article that talks about how secretly awesome and Jonny-tastic this card is.  
  
"Okay, guys, I know what you're thinking. But you can use her with cards that care about highest converted mana cost! And she's soooo much harder to hit with the deadly new [Gaze of Granite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaze of Granite)! And...wait, this is super secret tech here...you can ENCHANT HER. Or even, if you're really willing to splash for colorless, you can even try out some equipment. [Hedron Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hedron Matrix), anyone? And if you reanimate her, hoo doggy, now you're just getting KUH-RAZY."  
  
Also, I like the flavor text. We too will put the ranks of the guild before you, Emmara.

Posted By: ItsHarvestTime (4/23/2013 6:16:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
2/5  
She's a [Hexplate Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hexplate Golem) (rated 2.0), at rare (-0.25), with color restrictions (-0.25). Granted, she does have one ability (+0.5), but tokens will still have trouble with:  
[Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus)  
[Cyclonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cyclonic Rift)  
[Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict)  
[Sever the Bloodline](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sever the Bloodline)  
[Mutilate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mutilate)  
[Killing Wave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Killing Wave)  
[Gaze of Granite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaze of Granite)  
And other cards like [Aetherize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aetherize) and [Blustersquall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blustersquall)  
I think people are rating her low because they expected her to be a flavorful and awesome guild champion, but she's almost a vanilla 5/7.

Posted By: FatalEagle (4/23/2013 2:52:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
While she isn't the *best* card in the world, she is by no means 1.125 bad.  
  
  
EDIT: Wizards in no way should be getting this much backlash for printing this card. Sure, it isn't the greatest effect in the world, but she's *still a good card*. Tokens dominate when she hits the board, especially when they can attack without fear of opening themselves up via [Intangible Virtue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intangible Virtue). Don't be so ungrateful either, I mean it isn't like they work hard every year to release 1000+ cards for you to hate over.  
  
  
Good. God.

Cards I'd rather play than her.  
[Avacyn, Angel of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Angel of Hope)  
 [Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Vigor)  
[Asceticism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Asceticism)

and last but not least  
[Collective Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Collective Blessing)  
  
You know you screwed up when another rare in the same block and in the same colors is better than what should have been one of the flagship cards in the set. Was it really that much to ask for the card to MAKE THE ELEMENTAL IN THE BACKGROUND.

Posted By: .Blaze. (4/23/2013 4:11:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Awesome art, terrible card. If she costed less (ideally way less, with stats lowered to compensate of course (I think a 1/7 for 2WG would have been fine) or even better, if she made the tokens indestructible (which would actually save them from most board wipe, which is what actually concerns tokens), then she'd be liked more I think.   
  
As it stands, she's vastly underwhelming.

Posted By: Bluehero (4/23/2013 3:30:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Good lord people. She's not great, but she doesn't deserve a less than 2 star rating. Yeah she's expensive, but she's pretty big too. Okay so being big isn't in her vorthos unless you stretch the definition of her card to include her elemental.  
  
As for her ability, she makes your tokens wreck combat steps. Which is where token decks want to be wrecking anyway. I don't see why anyone would think that her ability should neuter mass bounce/removal.
posts.html:

As for her ability, she makes your tokens wreck combat steps. Which is where token decks want to be wrecking anyway. I don't see why anyone would think that her ability should neuter mass bounce/removal.
